content.question: double a = 1.1; double b = 1.2; if ((a + b) * (a - b) != (a * a) - (b * b)) { System.out.println("Mathematical error!"); } Which of the following best describes why the phrase "Mathematical error!" would be printed? (Remember that mathematically (a + b) * (a - b) = a2 - b2 .)

choices.label: Precedence rules make the if condition true.
Associativity rules make the if condition true.
Roundoff error makes the if condition true.
A compiler bug or hardware error has occurred.

content.answer: Roundoff error makes the if condition true.

skill.text: 4.A: Describe the behavior of a code segment or program.
